CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 6, 1957, pg. 1 reads: "2,000 at Opening Night - A jam-packed crowd of 2,000 persons attended the opening night of The Courier Home Service Fair at Syria Mosque, Tuesday night. Here is shown part of the throng flocked around the New Diamond market booth to receive jars of spaghetti given away by manager Charles Glick to the first 300 women to visit his booth.  The fair, one of the best ever presented in Pittsburgh, will close tonight (Thursday, March 21).  It will  be the biggest prize night of the fair and another capacity crowd is expected. - Harris photo."Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 6, 1957, pg. 17 reads: "5. The M. Lifsher and Son booth showing Saf-T-Tilt window won by Mrs. Fannie Nelson, 2166 Elmore Sq. James (Jim) H. Bloom, left, and representatives made the award"
TitMainTitle: Crowd gathered around M. Lifsher & Son booth with woman wearing rabbit costume handing out items, in Syria Mosque for the 1957 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair
